name: intragroup_bias_writing
instruction: Intragroup bias refers to the tendency for individuals within a group to favor or show preferential treatment towards other members of the same group over those who are outside the group. Give me an example.

instances.output: Team A and Team B. Team A members have been working together for several years and have developed strong bonds and a sense of camaraderie. When it comes time for a promotion, the manager, who is also from Team A, tends to favor members of their own team over equally qualified candidates from Team B.
